718737f-a.title: Manhattan: Cherry Street - Clinton Street
718737f-a.text:
Cherry Street (left), south side, east from Clinton to and including Montgomery Streets, showing the Seventh Ward Athletic Field extending south to Water Street, the buildings shown on the right, across the
athletic field, are facing on Water Street.
March 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
718737f-a.folder: Cherry Street & Clinton Street, Manhattan, NY

719007f-a.title: Manhattan: Clinton Street - Cherry Street
719007f-a.text:
Clinton Street, west side, north from and including Cherry Street. Also shown (left) is No. 314 Cherry, at the N.W. corner of Clinton Streets, and bearing also No. 251 on the latter street.
March 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
719007f-a.folder: Clinton Street & Cherry Street, Manhattan, NY

718736f-b.title: Manhattan: Cherry Street - Clinton Street
718736f-b.text:
Cherry Street, east from Clinton Street, showing tenements on the north side facing the Seventh Ward Athletic Field. At this date, this is being used for storage purposes. The factory
seen at the rignt margin is No. 5Bl Water Street.
View No. 3 is phoographed from this vantage point in a nor thward direction, to show Cherry Street buildings bearing No's. 326 to 336 (vacant lot at right) Facing these ahd obstrtucting them from view from this point, ware four,2Astory old structures (No's 327-to 333 Cherry Street) that have re3ently been rased.
April 23, 1939
Views: 1-2-3
P. L. Sperr
718736f-b.folder: Cherry Street & Clinton Street, Manhattan, NY

718735f-b.title: Manhattan: Cherry Street - Clinton Street
718735f-b.text:
Cherry Street, north side, west from but not including Wlinton Street. Note the clearance (center of view) created by the demolition of four
5-story buildings, Nos. 302 to 296.
March 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
Ne; ~ 222e
The New l(ork Wimes of July 15, 1938, reports the proposed demolition of No. 304 Cherry SStreet, which is the first 5 story tenement this side
of the clearance.
(2) and (3)
N,,~2657 The same area as No. 1, subesquent to the noted demolition ' (Vacant space in certer) and ddurin a similar project at the N.W. corner. View 3 emphasizes this last mentioned phase and includes a perspective along Clinton Street (right), across Monroe and
Madison Streets' respectively.
June 23, 1939

719008f-a.title: Manhattan: Clinton Street - Cherry Street
719008f-a.text:
250 to 244 Clinton Street, at, adjoining and north of the N.E. corner of Cherry Street. The view is across a clearance at the N.W. corner sid is in an eastward
direction.
August 2, 1939
L. Sperr
